1.0.6.description: A nodejs cli that convert css unit px to rem

2.0.1.name: pxtorem-css
2.0.1.description: A PostCSS plugin and CLI tool that converts px to rem/em/vw/vh units

scripts.prepublishOnly: npm run lint && npm run test && npm run build

description: A PostCSS plugin and CLI tool that converts px to rem/em/vw/vh units
readme:
pxtorem-css

A modern PostCSS plugin & CLI to convert px ‚Üí rem, em, vw, vh and more

--- ## ‚ú® Features - üéØ **Multiple Units** ‚Äî Convert to `rem`, `em`, `vw`, `vh`, `vmin`, `vmax`, `%` - ‚ö° **Fast & Lightweight** ‚Äî Zero dependencies (except postcss) - üîß **Highly Configurable** ‚Äî Per-property settings, custom transforms - üí¨ **Comment Control** ‚Äî Disable conversion with inline comments - üìä **Conversion Reports** ‚Äî Track what was converted - üñ•Ô∏è **CLI Included** ‚Äî Convert files from command line - ÔøΩ **TypeScript** ‚Äî Full type definitions included --- ## üì¶ Installation ```bash # npm npm install pxtorem-css postcss --save-dev # yarn yarn add pxtorem-css postcss -D # pnpm pnpm add pxtorem-css postcss -D ``` --- ## üöÄ Quick Start ### PostCSS Config ```js // postcss.config.js module.exports = { plugins: [ require('pxtorem-css')({ baseSize: 16, properties: ['*'], }), ], }; ``` ### CLI ```bash # Convert a file npx pxtorem style.css # With options npx pxtorem style.css -b 16 -u rem --min-value 2 ``` --- ## üìñ Usage Examples
Vite ```js // vite.config.js import { defineConfig } from 'vite'; import pxtorem from 'pxtorem-css'; export default defineConfig({ css: { postcss: { plugins: [ pxtorem({ baseSize: 16, properties: ['*'], }), ], }, }, }); ```
Next.js ```js // postcss.config.js module.exports = { plugins: { 'pxtorem-css': { baseSize: 16, properties: ['*'], }, }, }; ```
Webpack ```js // postcss.config.js module.exports = { plugins: [ require('pxtorem-css')({ baseSize: 16, properties: ['*'], minValue: 2, }), require('autoprefixer'), ], }; ```
Node.js Script ```js const fs = require('fs'); const postcss = require('postcss'); const pxtorem = require('pxtorem-css'); const css = fs.readFileSync('input.css', 'utf8'); postcss([pxtorem({ baseSize: 16 })]) .process(css) .then((result) => { fs.writeFileSync('output.css', result.css); }); ```
--- ## ‚öôÔ∏è Options | Option | Type | Default | Description | | --------------------- | ---------------------- | ---------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- | | `baseSize` | `number \| function` | `16` | Base font size for conversion | | `toUnit` | `string` | `'rem'` | Target unit (`rem`, `em`, `vw`, `vh`, `vmin`, `vmax`, `%`) | | `fromUnit` | `string` | `'px'` | Source unit to convert | | `precision` | `number` | `5` | Decimal precision | | `properties` | `string[]` | `['*']` | Properties to convert (supports wildcards) | | `skipSelectors` | `(string \| RegExp)[]` | `[]` | Selectors to skip | | `minValue` | `number` | `0` | Skip values below this | | `maxValue` | `number` | `Infinity` | Skip values above this | | `convertMediaQueries` | `boolean` | `false` | Convert in media queries | | `replaceOriginal` | `boolean` | `true` | Replace vs add fallback | | `propertyBaseSize` | `object` | `{}` | Per-property base sizes | | `convert` | `function` | `null` | Custom conversion function | | `verbose` | `boolean` | `false` | Log conversions | --- ## üé® Advanced Examples ### Property Wildcards ```js pxtorem({ properties: ['font*', '*margin*', '!border*'], // ‚úì font-size, font-weight, margin, margin-top // ‚úó border, border-width }); ``` ### Per-Property Base Size ```js pxtorem({ baseSize: 16, propertyBaseSize: { 'font-size': 14, 'line-height': 20, }, }); ``` ### Custom Transform ```js pxtorem({ convert: (px, property, selector) => { // Skip small values if (px < 4) return false; // Use CSS variable if (px === 16) return 'var(--base-size)'; // Round to 0.25rem return Math.round((px / 16) * 4) / 4; }, }); ``` ### Viewport Units (Mobile-First) ```js pxtorem({ toUnit: 'vw', baseSize: 3.75, // 375px / 100vw properties: ['*'], }); ``` --- ## üí¨ Comment Control Disable conversion with inline comments: ```css .element { font-size: 16px; /* ‚Üí 1rem */ padding: 20px; /* pxtorem-disable-line */ /* ‚Üí 20px (skipped) */ /* pxtorem-disable */ margin: 32px; /* ‚Üí 32px (skipped) */ border: 1px solid; /* ‚Üí 1px (skipped) */ /* pxtorem-enable */ width: 100px; /* ‚Üí 6.25rem */ } ``` | Comment | Effect | | --------------------------------- | -------------------- | | `/* pxtorem-disable-line */` | Skip current line | | `/* pxtorem-disable-next-line */` | Skip next line | | `/* pxtorem-disable */` | Disable until enable | | `/* pxtorem-enable */` | Re-enable | --- ## üñ•Ô∏è CLI Reference ```bash pxtorem [options] ``` | Option | Description | | ------------------------- | --------------------------------- | | `-o, --output ` | Output file/directory | | `-b, --base-size ` | Base font size | | `-u, --to-unit ` | Target unit | | `-p, --precision ` | Decimal precision | | `--properties ` | Comma-separated properties | | `--skip-selectors ` | Comma-separated selectors to skip | | `--min-value ` | Min px value | | `--max-value ` | Max px value | | `--media-queries` | Convert in media queries | | `--no-replace` | Add fallback instead of replacing | | `-v, --verbose` | Verbose output | | `-h, --help` | Show help | ### CLI Examples ```bash # Basic conversion pxtorem style.css # Custom options pxtorem style.css -b 16 -u rem -p 5 --min-value 2 # Different output pxtorem -o dist/styles.css src/styles.css # Directory conversion pxtorem -o dist/css src/css # Filter properties pxtorem style.css --properties "font-size,margin,padding" ``` --- ## üìò TypeScript ```ts import pxtorem, { Options, ConversionReport, TargetUnit } from 'pxtorem-css'; const options: Options = { baseSize: 16, toUnit: 'rem', onConversionComplete: (report: ConversionReport) => { console.log(`Converted: ${report.convertedDeclarations}`); }, }; ``` --- ## üìÑ License MIT ¬© [Rashed Iqbal](https://github.com/iqbal-rashed)
